results.title: The Muscle spindle
results.brief_description: This film shows how the electrical impulses produced by movement and tension of a muscle are transmitted to and received from the nervous system. The techniques for isolating a muscle spindle and keeping it alive outside the body are demonstrated.

results.title: The Moving camera, the moving subject
results.creator_credit: Lynn John, John A. Givins and KTV Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Video tech”.
This episode looks at the art of shooting movement. The composition of shots with a moving subject, such as walking room and depth of field, what happens when the subject moves, and how to deal with holding the action and combinations of movements are highlighted. Demonstrates the techniques of using a moving camera, such as tripod moves, zooming and tracking.

results.title: The Movies: our modern art. The Lost world revisited
results.creator_credit: Dennis R. Atkinson, W. Gyorgy and Spectre Pictures
results.brief_description: A tribute to the Special Effects wizardry of Willis H O’Brien. A 1925 production of Sir Arthur Conan Doyle’s story is a classic of the silent era, and with King Kong, produced eight years later, O’Brien was proved a master of special effects. Analyses his artistic genius and contains a rare interview with O’Brien taken shortly before his death in 1962.
results.title_for_label: The Movies: our modern art. The Lost world revisited
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis R. Atkinson, W. Gyorgy and Spectre Pictures

results.title: The Movies story
results.creator_credit: Gerald A Schiller and SL Film Productions
results.brief_description: Traces the history of film from 1895 to 1915, beginning with Edison’s first experiments and concluding with Chaplin’s early shorts. Emphasises the contributions of Melies, Griffith and Chaplin. Narrated by William Wintersole.

results.title: The Movie movie
results.creator_credit: Don White, George Johnson, John Taylor, ONF | NFB and Yaletown Productions Inc.
results.brief_description: The Movie Movie shows how the camera, editing techniques, make-up and sound can be used in film and video to deliberately manipulate our perceptions and emotions. Drama, action and slapstick humor are combined in a simple, family-oriented plot. There is no dialogue, but there is an explanatory song. Behind-the-scenes vignettes highlight the message that in a movie everything is not quite as it seems. Script and Text by Don White and Bruce Ruddell.Edited by Charles Wilkinson. Music by Bruce Ruddell.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don White, George Johnson, John Taylor, ONF | NFB and Yaletown Productions Inc.

results.title: The Movement of water inside and outside the fascicle = Faszikulare und extrafaszikulare wasserleitung
results.brief_description: The movement of water in plants is demonstrated using fluorescent solutions and time-lapse photographic techniques. Solutions absorbed into the plants formed an illuminated network of leaf structure which was photographed. The movement of liquid is demonstrated in the leaves, young twigs and stems of different types of plants. In German only.

results.title: The Mountain does it for me
results.creator_credit: Bill Snider, Len Aitken and Oak Creek Films
results.brief_description: Describes a ski program devised for youngsters with cerabral palsy. Looks at both the skiing and the special training and educational approach in the Children’s Hospital, Denver, Colorado. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
